newsitem.title: USA: Fed adds reserves via overnight, 10-day system RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed adds reserves via overnight, 10-day system RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve added temporary reserves to the banking system on Monday through overnight and 10-day system repurchase agreements, the Fed confirmed.
Federal funds were trading at 5-1/2 percent, the Fed's target for the rate, at the time of the operation.
Economists had expected a multi-day reserve addition, citing seasonal pressures as well as shifts related to the April 15 personal income tax date.
-- E. Freilich, North American Treasury Desk 212-859-1679
